project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Icon for Customer Portal announcement is shown incorrectly in different web browsers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the customer portal as a project/system admin.
 # Add an announcement.

h3. Expected Results
The announcement message will be displayed, with a "loudspeaker" icon on the left.

h3. Actual Results
The announcement message will be displayed, with a "loudspeaker" icon showing "broken" in Firefox and Chrome, while displaying correctly in Edge:
* Chrome 76:  !image-2019-09-10-22-14-03-730.png|thumbnail! 
* Edge:  !image-2019-09-10-22-12-11-215.png|thumbnail! 
* Firefox 69:  !image-2019-09-10-22-13-40-221.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes
* The issue is *not present in* Jira Core *8.2.1* / SD *4.2.1*

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Icon for Customer Portal announcement is shown incorrectly in different web browsers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Currently, Service Desk customer portal offers access to end customers to raise issues with Service Desk. There is no unified (and simplified) frontend interface that would give unique access to both Customers, Agents and Jira users for both Jira Service Desk / Jira Core. Also, for simplicity, users should not be asked to log in when switching from one application to another.

h3. Suggested resolution
Implement a frontend application that would provide access and features as described above.
fields.summary: Simplified frontend application for combined Jira Service Desk / Jira usage

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Incorrect French translation in the CSAT feedback page 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the Project settings, enable the Customer Satisfaction survey.
# Set the system language to French.
# Create a service desk request.
# Resolve the request.
# The customer receives a CSAT survey email, rate the service selecting any of the stars and the customer will be redirected to a page confirming the rate as well as asking for additional comment.

h3. Expected Results
The feedback page is shown, indicating "Si vous avez un moment, dites-nous comment les choses se sont *passées *pour que nous puissions garder le cap."

h3. Actual Results
"Si vous avez un moment, dites-nous comment les choses se sont *passés* pour que nous puissions garder le cap."

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The translation can be modified directly from the Service Desk files following the guide  https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-service-desk-internationalization-675188939.html

The translation key for this specific issue is located in your Jira Home/plugins/installed-plugins/jira-servicedesk-application-x.x.x.jar, inside that file, in the directory _i18n,_ you find the file _sd-i18n_fr_FR.properties,_ and in that file, the translation can be found in the key "cv.feedback.confirm.page.comment.label.happy".
fields.summary: Incorrect French translation in the CSAT feedback page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sharing a link from "Related knowledgebase articles" panel creates a comment with an incorrectly formatted link. 

Specifically, the hostname is missing which causes the formatting to break.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Connect JSD to confluence for knowledge base integration 
 # Goto any ticket and in related knowledgebase articles click "Add a comment". 
 # Check created comment. The formatting is incorrect. See Image attached.

h3. Expected Results

The comment should show up as a link to customer
h3. Actual Results

The comment link markup is missing the hostname and thus does not show up as a link to the customer.
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, before posting the comment, agents will have to manually add the JSD hostname to the URL path generated in the comment.
fields.summary: Sharing KB link as comment using the Add Comment button creates comment with incorrect formatting

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Special characters like double-quote (") and ampersand (&) are escaped in an Organization name.
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue
 # Create an organization and include the special characters such as (") or (&) in it's name.
 # Once created, click on the organization name to manage the customers under it.

h3. Expected result

The organization name renders correctly.
h3. Actual result

The characters are escaped. For example, (&) will be rendered as 
{code:none}&{code}
 !amp-org-jsd.jpg|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Note

So far it affects the characters *& < > " '* (XML escaped characters)
fields.summary: Certain special characters are escaped in an organization name

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi Jira Support,

In our application, we have configured SLA information for all incident requests. Every month we have to generate the incident list to review SLA information (such as Response Time, Workaround Time & Resolution Time).

when I generate the list in service portal using filter, these SLA information are showing correctly. But when I exported to excel format, SLA information are showing the test "$remainingTimeHumanReadable" instead of the correct time. 

 

Please suggest if I can configure somewhere in Service portal in order to reflect that information in exported excel/csv/pdf format.

 

Thanks.
fields.summary: SLA time doesn't reflect on exported excel file

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While we have the tooltip by mouse over to get the full title of a Knowledge-Based in a Customer Portal using a Desktop, there is no mouseover in Mobile Devices.

h3. Steps to Reproduce.
# Link JIRA Service Desk with Confluence for the KB feature.
# After it is linked, create a page with a long title.
# Using a Smart Phone, access JIRA Service Desk Customer Portal through:
{code}<JIRA Base URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals{code}
# Search for the Page from the Customer Portal in Mobile View.
# Click on the search result to view the full page.

h3. Expected Result
The title will be shown fully.

h3. Actual Result
The same will happen as with accessing JIRA through Desktop where the tile is truncated with "Triple Dot" where there is no mouseover when accessing the page through mobile.

h3. Workaround
Not found yet
fields.summary: Customer Portal does not support long Knowledge-Based title in Mobile View

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

After migrating Jira from Cloud to Server, Service Desk project administrators *might get* the "Snap! You can't view this page" error when trying to access any Service Desk specific setting (Request Type, SLA, Automation...).

!SnapYouCantViewThisPage.png|thumbnail!
h3. +Diagnosis Steps+

To verify if you are impacted by this bug, check if you can find the following error in the file {{atlassian-servicedesk.log}}:
{code:java}
2019-07-24 16:53:55,569 JIRA-EventThread-10 ERROR removed XXXXXXX xxxxx XXX.XXX.XX.XXX /plugins/servlet/applications/versions-licenses/add-licenses/jira-servicedesk/evaluation [bootstrap.lifecycle.server.ServerPluginLifeCycle] org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:CustomFieldValue][parentkey,null][customfield,11104][issue,134138][textvalue,{"timeline":{"events":[{"date":1562687139307,"types":["START"]},{"date":1562710975499,"types":["STOP"]}]},"ongoingSLAData":null,"completeSLAData":[{"succeeded":true,"goalTime":28800000,"elapsedTime":22975499,"calendarName":"Sample 9-5 Calendar","startTime":1562687139307,"stopTime":1562710975499}],"metricId":12,"definitionChangeDate":null,"definitionChangeMsEpoch":0,"goalsChangeDate":null,"goalsChangeMsEpoch":null,"goalTimeUpdatedDate":null,"goalTimeUpdatedMsEpoch":null,"metricCreatedDate":null}][id,2292400][updated,1563987235564] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.customfieldvalue (ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_customfieldvalue"
  Detail: Key (id)=(2292400) already exists.))
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:CustomFieldValue][parentkey,null][customfield,11104][issue,134138][textvalue,{"timeline":{"events":[{"date":1562687139307,"types":["START"]},{"date":1562710975499,"types":["STOP"]}]},"ongoingSLAData":null,"completeSLAData":[{"succeeded":true,"goalTime":28800000,"elapsedTime":22975499,"calendarName":"Sample 9-5 Calendar","startTime":1562687139307,"stopTime":1562710975499}],"metricId":12,"definitionChangeDate":null,"definitionChangeMsEpoch":0,"goalsChangeDate":null,"goalsChangeMsEpoch":null,"goalTimeUpdatedDate":null,"goalTimeUpdatedMsEpoch":null,"metricCreatedDate":null}][id,2292400][updated,1563987235564] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.customfieldvalue (ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, UPDATED, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "pk_customfieldvalue"
{code}
h3. +Root cause+

The root cause is unknown at this moment, as we have been unable to reproduce this issue on Atlassian side. For this reason, it is not guarantee that any customer migrating from Cloud to Server will run into this bug.

Note that a similar bug was reported in the past in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-6538 when customers were migrating from Cloud to Server. However, that bug was fixed in JSD 3.2.6, therefore this seems to be a new unrelated bug.
h3. +Workaround+

The error in the logs is addressed in the KB article [Cannot insert duplicate key in object when adding content to a JIRA application|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/cannot-insert-duplicate-key-in-object-when-adding-content-to-a-jira-application-200709825.html], therefore the resolution steps are the same, except for the affected table which is different.

We have adjusted the steps below for this specific bug.

First, let's confirm that the workaround applies to your situation by following the steps below:
 # Connect to the Jira database
 # Check the max ID value from the *_customfieldvalue_* by running the following query (*query 1*):
{code:java}
select max(ID) from "customfieldvalue"{code}
 # Check the actual sequence from the *sequence_value_item* table for the Custom Field Value by running the following query (*query 2*):
{code:java}
select * from "sequence_value_item" where seq_name = 'CustomFieldValue';{code}
 # Verify that the max ID from the *customfieldvalue* table is *higher* than the value from the *sequence_value_item* in your database (although in a normal situation, it should be *lower*). If that's the case, then the workaround below applies to you

Workaround steps:
 # Stop Jira
 # (!) Backup your Jira database, so that you can revert back the changes if anything goes wrong
 # Connect to the Jira database
 # Update the *sequence_value_item* table by running the following query (*query 3*) and replacing xxxxx with the value from the results of {color:#d04437}*query 1* + 1{color} (for example, if the result from *query 1* was 1000, update xxxxx using 1001):
{code:java}
update "sequence_value_item" set seq_id = xxxxx where seq_name = 'CustomFieldValue';{code}
 # Start Jira
 # Access a Service Desk project configuration page, and check if you are still facing the same issue
fields.summary: "Snap! You can't view this page" error after migrating from Cloud to Server

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 21 November 2016}
We have identified number of issues why the import problem are not resolved for the Service Desk projects.

Team has identified 2 separate issues:
 * Service Desk permissions lost when importing CloudData into Server
 * Service Desk throws NullPointer exception when projects with mail channels is imported from the Cloud -JSD-4190-

 

*Service Desk permissions lost when importing CloudData into Server*

This issue was planned to be shipped with 7.2.3 release and that's when issue got resolved. After number of issue comments I've reopened the issue. Root cause analysis identified that JIRA Service Desk 7.2.3 / Service Desk Application, in fact has, not shipped the code changes that addresses the fix.

We have addressed this issue and upcoming JIRA Service Desk 7.2.5 and Service Desk application 3.2.5 will be shipping all the necessary changes.

 

*Service Desk throws NullPointer exception when projects with mail channels is imported from the Cloud*

This issue has been discovered later, and identified as a separate issue and tracked as -JSD-4190-.
 The fix for this is included in JIRA Service Desk 7.2.5 and Service Desk application 3.2.5

 

*Service Desk throws NullPointerException when request types are missing the ICON_ID*

This issue has been discovered in certain customer data sets. Issue is tracked as JSD-4227. The fix for this is scheduled for Service Desk application 3.2.6.

 

(on) Atlassian Support can provide a workaround for the cases described in -JSD-4190-, and JSD-4227 please contact the team if upgrading or waiting for 7.2.5 is not an option. These requests can be raised at [http://support.atlassian.com|http://support.atlassian.com/]

 

Cheers,
 Ignat
 JIRA Bugmaster.
{panel}
 
h3. Problem

After restoring backup from Cloud, viewing a Service Desk project will be restricted with message {{Snap! You can't view this page You need to be a Service Desk Agent to access this page}}.
 !settings.PNG|thumbnail!
h3. Symptoms
 * You are restricted from viewing all Service Desk related project administration settings (Request types, Request security, Portal settings etc until Automation) despite you are an Agent and Admin who should be able to do so
 * In each Service Desk Project Permission Scheme, the *Service Desk Agent* project permission is missing.
 * Buttons for Queues, Customers, Reports etc are missing from the project navigation bar (left panel)
 * In {{JIRA Administration > Applications}}, the section for JIRA Service Desk's *Configuration* and *Email requests* is also missing
 * In {{atlassian-servicedesk.log}} or {{atlassian-jira.log}} while browsing the Service Desk project, error below is seen
{code:java}2016-08-31 19:03:16,901 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 INFO admin 1136x5153x1 yt6xtk 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle] Enabling ServiceDesk mail channels...
2016-08-31 19:03:17,169 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR admin 1136x5153x1 yt6xtk 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle] 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at scala.Predef$.Long2long(Predef.scala:358)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailChannelSetting$.toModel(EmailChannelSetting.scala:30)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailChannelSettingManager.com$atlassian$servicedesk$internal$feature$emailchannel$emailplatform$EmailChannelSettingManager$$toSettingModel(EmailChannelSettingManager.scala:124)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailChannelSettingManager$$anonfun$getEmailChannelSettings$1.apply(EmailChannelSettingManager.scala:105)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailChannelSettingManager$$anonfun$getEmailChannelSettings$1.apply(EmailChannelSettingManager.scala:105)
	at scala.collection.immutable.List.map(List.scala:273)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.emailchannel.emailplatform.EmailChannelSettingManager.getEmailChannelSettings(EmailChannelSettingManager.scala:105)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.SDMailChannelInitializer.updateSDMailChannels(SDMailChannelInitializer.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.SDMailChannelInitializer.enableSDMailChannels(SDMailChannelInitializer.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.bootstrap.lifecycle.PluginLifeCycle.runPluginStartupSideEffectsImpl(PluginLifeCycle.java:201)






{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
 # Restore a backup from Cloud into JIRA 7.2.x and Service Desk 3.2.x.
 # Navigate to an existing Service Desk project, or create a new Service Desk project.
 # Click on the Project Settings button and click to view Request types or other Service Desk related project administration settings.

h3. Notes

This same symptom can also be caused by -JSD-4190-, specifically if JIRA Service Desk cannot fully start up, certain functionality will work and others not work. It will appear as installed, but these same behaviours fail. Please verify if you're affected by -JSD-4190- as it may be that bug instead.
h3. Workaround

Upon restoring a Cloud backup, running the following SQL queries to delete the Cloud-related email channels will help recover the Agent permission:
 * For PostgreSQL:
{code:java}1. delete from "AO_54307E_EMAILCHANNELSETTING" where "ON_DEMAND" = 't';

2. delete from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILHANDLER" where "MAIL_CHANNEL_ID" not in (select "ID" from "AO_54307E_EMAILCHANNELSETTING") or "HANDLER_TYPE" = 'CONNECTIONFAILUREHANDLER';

3. delete from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILCHANNEL" where "MAIL_CONNECTION_ID" in (select "ID" from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILCONNECTION" where "EMAIL_ADDRESS" like '%atlassian.net');

4. delete from "AO_2C4E5C_MAILCONNECTION" where "EMAIL_ADDRESS" like '%atlassian.net';
{code}

 * For other database types:
{code:java}1. delete from AO_54307E_EMAILCHANNELSETTING where ON_DEMAND = 1;

2. delete from AO_2C4E5C_MAILHANDLER where MAIL_CHANNEL_ID not in (select ID from AO_54307E_EMAILCHANNELSETTING) or HANDLER_TYPE = 'CONNECTIONFAILUREHANDLER';

3. delete from AO_2C4E5C_MAILCHANNEL where MAIL_CONNECTION_ID in (select ID from AO_2C4E5C_MAILCONNECTION where EMAIL_ADDRESS like '%atlassian.net');

4. delete from AO_2C4E5C_MAILCONNECTION where EMAIL_ADDRESS like '%atlassian.net';
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there is a special character used in the Attachment title, the customer will encounter a 403 Forbidden Error when they try to access it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce.
# As an agent, Attach a file with a special character
(i) Attaching a sample for replication use
# Make sure that it is shared to the customer
# After the comment is added, log into the same request as the customer.
# Click on the attachment from the customer portal.

h3. Expected Result
The Customer will be able to download or view the attachment without any problem

h3. Actual Result
The Customer will encounter a 403 Forbidden Error

h3. Workaround.
No Workaround can be found as:
- Renaming already added attachment is not possible
- Using the URL Link Address and share it through the comment will throw the same problem
- Giving an Alias to the attachment also did not work
{code}[Alias|^filename]{code}

h3. Note
- The same issue is not happening in version 4.3.1 and 4.3.0
- The Agent can open the attachment from the Portal without any issue
- *If the instance is upgraded to this version, this means that any existing attachment that had such characters will not be viewable in this version*
fields.summary: 403 Forbidden Error when Customer opening an attachment with special character

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently once a user rates a resolved ticket from their email, then this directs them to a popup to specify a comment if any:
 !1.png|thumbnail! 
The current messaging on this page would give users the impression that they need to fill the comment field (seems mandatory as the submit button is not selectable) to be able to submit the rating for the ticket. However in reality, the rating is submitted as soon a the customer specifies this from the email and this popup page is shown just to capture any comments that customers may want to provide with regards to the rating provided.  

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide more clearing messaging on this popup page mentioning that their rating has already been captured and that they may use this page to provide comments on why they gave that particular rating else, they may close the page if if they do not want to provide any comments on their rating.
fields.summary: Unclear messaging on optional comment page for Customer Satisfaction

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Custom automation rule with WHEN: "Approval required" will not work if approval was abandoned by transition other then Approve/Decline (for example, if there is "Back" transition in case user accidentally transition issue to Approval status) and when transitioned again to Approval.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Set up new workflow with statuses 'Open', 'Approving', & 'To Do'.
 # Create the following transitions:
Open -> Approving with the transition 'To approval'
Approving -> Open with the transition 'Back to Open'
Approving -> To Do with the transition 'Approve'
Approving -> Open with the transition 'Decline'
 # Set up approval in status 'Approving'
Approve by Approvers, Approve/Decline transitions
 # Remove condition "Issue transition will be blocked if there is pending approval.
" from 'Back to Open' transition.
 # Set up automation rule triggered by "Approval required" event (any action like comment or webhook).
 # Transition issue from 'Open' to 'Approving'. (Automation Rule will work fine)
 # Transition issue from 'Approving' to 'Open' using the transition 'Back to Open'
 # Transition issue again to status 'Approving'. 

h3. Expected Results

Custom automation rule with WHEN: "Approval required" will work if approval was abandoned by transition other then Approve/Decline.
h3. Actual Results

Custom automation rule with WHEN: "Approval required" will not work if approval was abandoned by transition other then Approve/Decline.

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom automation rule with WHEN: "Approval required" will not work if approval was abandoned by transition other then Approve/Decline.

fields.description:
h3. +Issue description+

Some Service Desk functionalities are not working for some customers using Service Desk 4.3.0 or higher with a MS SQL (Microsoft SQL Server) database.

The functionalities that are known to be impacted are listed below:
 - Customers cannot access their requests on the customer portal
 - Customers can't be added as request participants
 - the Service desk mail handler won't process any incoming email

(!) Note that this list is not exhaustive, as more functionalities might be impacted
(!) Note that this bug is known to only impact customers who had Service Desk 1.x or 2.x installed at some point. This bug does not impact customers who have been using Service Desk from the version 3.x or higher.

h3. +Diagnosis Steps+

To verify if you are impacted by this bug, check if:
- you are using Service Desk 4.3.x (or Jira 8.3.x)
- Jira is connected to a Microsoft SQL Database
- you can find any of the 2 following errors in the Jira Logs (if you can see it, then you are likely impacted):
-- error 1
{code:java}
2019-08-12 12:18:17,027 JIRA-Bootstrap ERROR [bootstrap.lifecycle.server.ServerPluginLifeCycle] ActiveObjects could not be initialised
com.atlassian.pocketknife.api.ao.ActiveObjectInitialisationException: ActiveObjects could not be initialised
at com.atlassian.pocketknife.internal.ao.ActiveObjectsControllerImpl.initialise(ActiveObjectsControllerImpl.java:42)

Caused by: com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
- name:Microsoft SQL Server
- version:13.00.5366
- minor version:0
- major version:13
Driver:
- name:Microsoft JDBC Driver 7.2 for SQL Server
- version:7.2.1.0

com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The object 'df_AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK_PROJECT_KEY' is dependent on column 'PROJECT_KEY'.
{code}
-- error 2:
{code}
Exception executing SQL update <ALTER TABLE jiraschema.AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK ALTER COLUMN PROJECT_KEY NVARCHAR(255)>
com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The object 'df_AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK_PROJECT_KEY' is dependent on column 'PROJECT_KEY'.
{code}

h3. +Workaround+

*Workaround 1*

This workaround consists in updating the column type of PROJECT_KEY from VARCHAR to NVARCHAR for the AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK table

{panel:bgColor=lightyellow}
(!) It is critical that you engage your DBA to perform the following steps, and to make and verify the validity of a backup prior to manually modifying the database.  Atlassian cannot take responsibility for lost or corrupted data when manual modifications are made.
(!) *DO NOT* proceed with these steps unless you have a valid database backup.
{panel}
# Remove the 'df_AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK_PROJECT_KEY' constraint:{code}ALTER TABLE [dbo].[AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK] DROP CONSTRAINT [df_AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK_PROJECT_KEY];{code}
# Manually modify the PROJECT_KEY column as shown in the error message: {code}ALTER TABLE dbo.AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK ALTER COLUMN PROJECT_KEY NVARCHAR(255);{code}
# Re-add the constraint using the output you provided in your previous update: {code}ALTER TABLE [dbo].[AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK] ADD CONSTRAINT [df_AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK_PROJECT_KEY] DEFAULT ('N/A') FOR [PROJECT_KEY]
GO;{code}


*Workaround 2*

# Generate a new XML backup in Jira by using [Jira's XML Backup utility|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/backing-up-data-938847673.html#Backingupdata-xml_backupUsingJira'sXMLbackuputility]
# Shutdown Jira
# Create a new empty database for Jira in the MS SQL database, per the instructions in [Connecting Jira applications to a database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/connecting-jira-applications-to-a-database-938846850.html]
# Delete the dbconfig.xml file in your JIRA home directory.
# Restart JIRA and you should see the first step of the [JIRA setup wizard|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/running-the-setup-wizard-828787582.html] for configuring your database connection.
# Configure JIRA's connection to your new database (created in step 2 above) and click the 'Next' button.
# On the 'Application Properties' setup page, click the 'import your existing data' link and [restore your data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/restoring-data-828788092.html] from the XML backup created in step 1 above.
fields.summary: Several Service Desk functionalities are broken on Service Desk 4.3.x with a Microsoft SQL database

fields.description:
A URL path traversal vulnerability in Jira Service Desk Server and Jira Service Desk Data Center allows a remote attacker with portal access to view all issues from all projects in the affected instance. This could include Jira Service Desk projects, Jira Core projects, and Jira Software projects. Note that when the [*Anyone can email the service desk or raise a request in the portal* setting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/managing-access-to-your-service-desk-939926273.html] is enabled, an attacker can grant themselves portal access, allowing them to exploit the vulnerability.
h3. Affected Versions
 * All versions prior to 3.9.16
 * Versions from 3.10.0 prior to 3.16.8
 * Versions from 4.0.0 prior to 4.1.3
 * Versions from 4.2.0 prior to 4.2.5
 * Versions from 4.3.0 prior to 4.3.4
 * Version 4.4.0

h3. Workaround
 * Block requests to Jira containing {{..}} at the reverse proxy or load balancer level
 * Alternatively, configure Jira to redirect requests containing {{..}} to a safe URL via {{urlrewrite.xml}}
 ** Please see  [Jira KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/migating-url-path-traversal-for-affected-cve-2019-14994-976762572.html] for workaround details
 * [Restart Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/start-and-stop-jira-applications-938847802.html]

Refer to the [Jira KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/migating-url-path-traversal-for-affected-cve-2019-14994-976762572.html] for more information on these workarounds.
h3. Fix

*Note:* Upgrading Jira Service Desk also requires upgrading Jira Core. Check the [compatibility matrix|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjira/jira-applications-compatibility-matrix-875304597.html] to find the equivalent version for your Jira Service Desk version.
 * 4.4.1 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk/update].
 * 4.3.4 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk/update].
 * 4.2.5 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk/update].
 * 4.1.3 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk/update].
 * 3.16.8 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk/update].
 * 3.9.16 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk/update].

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-service-desk-security-advisory-2019-09-11-976171274.html].
fields.summary: URL Path Traversal in Jira Service Desk Server and Jira Service Desk Data Center Allows Information Disclosure - CVE-2019-14994

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

Service Desk notifications completely stop being sent if a comment is added to a request and contains a high number of links (~100k).

The job responsible to send the notifications gets completely stuck, and re-starting Jira does not resolve the issue.

*Diagnosis steps*

If you are impacted by the bug, you'll see the following symptoms:
 - if you run the following query in the database, you'll find that there are a lot of customer notifications waiting to be sent (SENT_TIME is null):
{code:java}
SELECT count (*) FROM "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" WHERE "SENT_TIME" is null
{code}
 - if you run the following query in the database, you'll find that the job responsible to send the notifications is stuck and shows as "Already running"
 -- Query:
{code:java}
select * from rundetails where job_id = 'sd.custom.notification.batch.send';
{code}
 -- Example of results:
{noformat:java}
    id    |              job_id               |         start_time         | run_duration | run_outcome |  info_message   
----------+-----------------------------------+----------------------------+--------------+-------------+-----------------
 71507893 | sd.custom.notification.batch.send | 2019-08-14 16:35:37.707+00 |            1 | A           | Already running
{noformat}
 - you can also verify that this job is stuck from the UI in *⚙ > System > Scheduler details*, as it shows as "Already running":
!JobAlreadyRunning.png|thumbnail!
 - if you generate thread dumps, you'll see that there is a runnable thread stuck in the method {{com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.IssueUrlConverterImpl.replaceIssueUrlsWithPortalRequestUrls}}:
{code:java}
"Caesium-2-1" #20668 daemon prio=5 tid=0x0000000004770000 nid=0x5b42 runnable [0x00007f740d93f000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.lang.String.indexOf(String.java:1769)
	at java.lang.String.indexOf(String.java:1718)
	at org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils.replaceEach(StringUtils.java:4075)
	at org.apache.commons.lang.StringUtils.replaceEach(StringUtils.java:3868)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.IssueUrlConverterImpl.replaceIssueUrlsWithPortalRequestUrls(IssueUrlConverterImpl.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.CustomerTextRendererImpl.updateCustomerTextIntertal(CustomerTextRendererImpl.java:159)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.CustomerTextRendererImpl.updateEmailTextForCustomer(CustomerTextRendererImpl.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.notifications.render.StylingBodyFinaliserImpl.buildMultiPartHtmlEmailBody(StylingBodyFinaliserImpl.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.notifications.render.StylingBodyFinaliserImpl.buildMessageBodyForRecipient(StylingBodyFinaliserImpl.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.notifications.render.StylingBodyFinaliserImpl.lambda$buildHtmlBody$0(StylingBodyFinaliserImpl.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.notifications.render.StylingBodyFinaliserImpl$$Lambda$2582/1308621309.apply(Unknown Source)
	at io.atlassian.fugue.Either$RightProjection.map(Either.java:872)
	at io.atlassian.fugue.Either.map(Either.java:217)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.notifications.render.StylingBodyFinaliserImpl.buildHtmlBody(StylingBodyFinaliserImpl.java:55)
{code}
 - When enabling the debugging package {{com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.notifications}} in *⚙ > System > Logging and profiling > Configure logging level for another package*, noticed that the job responsible to send the notifications keep being skipped (because there is already a job that is stuck):
{code:java}
2019-07-10 10:29:08,193 PsmqAsyncExecutors-job:thread-5747 DEBUG XXXXXXX XXXXXXX XXXXXX XX.XXX.X.XX /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa [c.a.s.p.n.internal.scheduler.NotificationBatchScheduler] Notification batch sending job already defined. Skip scheduling.
{code}

*Workaround*

The workaround consists in deleting all the customer notifications from the table "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" which are waiting to be sent by the job that is stuck. Unfortunately, it is the only workaround known as of now.

(!) Please be aware that if you apply this workaround, you will lose all these pending notifications as they will be deleted from the database.

The steps are:
 # Stop Jira
 # Backup your database
 # Run the following DELETE query. (!) Note that this query has been tested on a postgreSQL database:
{code:java}
delete from "AO_4E8AE6_NOTIF_BATCH_QUEUE" WHERE "SENT_TIME" is null;
{code}
 # Start Jira
fields.summary: Customer notifications stop being sent from any Service Desk issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Replying a Service Desk notification To a Different Service Desk Mailbox, the Mail processor will create a comment in the original ticket

h3. Environment
Tested on Jira 8.2.4 and Service Desk 4.2.3, this is impacting regular Jira mail handler as well

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 different Service Desk projects
# Create two completely separate mailboxes
# In each Service Desk project, configure the email channel using the specific Mailboxes created
# Now, we got:-
** Project 1 and Project 2
** Mailbox 1 and Mailbox 2
** Mail Channel 1 which connected with project 1 in mailbox 1 creating IT Help requests
** Mail Channel 2 which connected with project 2 in mailbox 2 creating Requests
# Open a ticket in project 1, create a comment or any action trigger notification
(i) You need to have an outgoing mail configured, else no notification will be sent out
# Wait for notification received in your mailbox
# Reply to the notification, update receiver email as mailbox 1 email address
# Forward the notification to the mailbox 2 email address, in order to create a new request in Project 2.

h3. Expected Results
# Jira will create a new request in Project 2, with the Forwarded mail body.

h3. Actual Results
Jira added a comment in the existing ticket from project 1 regardless of which mailbox is receiving the email reply.

h3. Workaround
-

h3. Additional Notes:

This can lead to a potential security breach in a company business that manages multiple Service Desks in the same Jira instance to different departments.
fields.summary: When Replying/Forwarding Jira Service Desk Notification to a different Service Desk, Mail Processor will create a comment in the original ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a custom field has a context configured with specific issue types (rather than with all issue types), the field cannot be updated within Automation rule action and error appears instead of possible field values.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field
 # On Custom fields page > find the field > click Configure
 # Edit Configuration > select some issue type (make sure it is not "Any issue type") > select Modify
 # Go to Jira project settings > Automation > edit (or create) a rule
 # In THEN block, click "Add action" > Edit issue > Add > search for and select newly created field

h3. Expected Results

Available field values are displayed OR user gets a message that there is no context applicable for this project (therefore, user should not be able to select this field).
h3. Actual Results

The following error gets displayed in Jira:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 At the same time, the following gets logged:
{code:java}
019-08-14 12:54:03,998 http-nio-8240-exec-11 WARN admin 774x1027x1 ijrev8 172.29.89.30 /rest/servicedesk/automation/servicedeskmodules/1/then/edit-issue/10000/field [c.atlassian.ozymandias.SafePluginPointAccess] Unable to run plugin code because of 'com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException - config should not be null!
{code}
h3. Workaround

Potential workaround could be to define a new context for the project where Automation rule will be defined. However, the context needs to be applied to "Any issue type":
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 Then, the Automation action won't display any error:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

(!) This workaround is not applicable if the project requires to have this field context applied to a certain issue type.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a request is moved from one Service Desk project to another one. the Request Type field shows as "no match".
 Even though the Request Type does not seem to be set, the 2 following behaviors happen:
 # The Request is still visible from the Customer Portal (which is incorrect, since the Request Type needs to be set for a request to show on the portal)
 # It will be impossible to find this request in the issue search by using the JQL query "Customer Request Type" is EMPTY (even though the Request Type shows as "no match")

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Install a fresh JIRA 8.1.0 instance with JSD 4.1.0
 # Create 2 Service Desk projects (Let's call them BASICSD and SDTEST)
 # Create a ticket in the project BASICD from the customer portal
 # Open this ticket from the JIRA UI and verify that the request type is set (it does not show as "no match"), and that the Channel is set to "Portal":
 !Step1.png|thumbnail!
 # Move the ticket from BASICSD to SDTEST and do not select a Request Type during the step 3 of the moving process:
 !Step2.png|thumbnail! 
 !Step3.png|thumbnail!
 # After the ticket is moved, verify that the channel is still set to "Portal" and that the Request Type field is empty (No match):
 !Step4.png|thumbnail!
 # Try to look for this ticket (issue key SDTEST-108) by searching for tickets with empty Request Type
{code:java}
"Customer Request Type" is EMPTY AND issuekey = SDTEST-108
{code}

h3. Actual Results
 # The JQL query does not return any result
 !Step5.png|thumbnail!
 # However, the following JQL query returns the request SDTEST-108
{code:java}
"Customer Request Type" is not EMPTY AND issuekey = SDTEST-108
{code}
!Step6.png|thumbnail!

 # The link "View customer request" is visible when opening the request from the JIRA View, and when clicking on it, the Request can be seen from the customer portal:
!step9.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
 # The JQL query should find the request, like it's the case when a Service Desk request is created from the JIRA UI:
 !Step8.png|thumbnail!
 # The link "View customer request" should not be visible when opening the request from the JIRA View and the request should not be accessible from the customer portal, like it's the case when a Service Desk request is created from the JIRA UI:
 !Step7.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

To determine which Service Desk requests are impacted by this issue, run the following query in the Jira DB.
{code:java}
select p.pkey as "projectkey", ji.issuenum, cfv.stringvalue as "requesttype", ep.json_value as "channel"
from jiraissue ji inner join project p on ji.project = p.id
        left join entity_property ep on ep.entity_id = ji.id and ep.property_key = 'request.channel.type'
        left join customfieldvalue cfv on ji.id = cfv.issue and
                cfv.customfield = (select id from customfield where cfname = 'Customer Request Type')
where ep.json_value like '%portal%' and p.pkey = '<PROJECT_KEY_UPPERCASE>' and cfv.stringvalue not like '<PROJECT_KEY_LOWER_CASE>/%' order by 2;
{code}
This query will return the project key and issue number of the impacted tickets. You may then bulk edit them in JIRA Issue Navigator and give them a valid request type value.

(!) Notes Regarding the workaround:
 - This query has been tested in Postgres, and might need to be slightly changed for other DB
 - You need to replace in the query:
 -- <PROJECT_KEY_UPPERCASE> with the project key in upper case
 -- <PROJECT_KEY_LOWER_CASE> with the project key lower case

For example, if the impacted project is SDTEST, the query will be:
{code:java}
select p.pkey as "projectkey", ji.issuenum, cfv.stringvalue as "requesttype", ep.json_value as "channel"
from jiraissue ji inner join project p on ji.project = p.id
        left join entity_property ep on ep.entity_id = ji.id and ep.property_key = 'request.channel.type'
        left join customfieldvalue cfv on ji.id = cfv.issue and
                cfv.customfield = (select id from customfield where cfname = 'Customer Request Type')
where ep.json_value like '%portal%' and p.pkey = 'SDTEST' and cfv.stringvalue not like 'sdtest/%' order by 2;

{code}
fields.summary: Invalid request type behavior when moving a Service Desk request to a new project

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary

When using Service Desk 4.3.0, the *Approve* and *Decline* buttons are not showing on the customer portal. and Approvals section is not showing in Jira view when either the system language is set to Russian, or the approver's profile language is set to Russian.

h3. Steps to reproduce

- Install a fresh Service Desk 4.3.0 instance
- Create a new Service Desk project
- Go to the customer portal
- Create a new request with approval and set the approver to any user (it can be the same user as the one creating the request)
- Log into the customer portal as the approver
- Go to the profile page by clicking on the avatar
- Change the profile language to Russian
- Open the request waiting for approval

h3. Actual result

The *Approve* and *Decline* buttons are missing.
 !ApprovalButton_JSD430.png|thumbnail! 

The Approvals section is empty in the Jira view
 !ApprovalsSection.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected result

The *Approve* and *Decline* buttons should be visible, as it is the case with JSD 4.1.0 as shown in the screenshot below:
 !ApprovalButton_JSD410.png|thumbnail! 

The Approvals section is showing information

h3. Workarounds

*Workaround 1*

Switch the user language profile to a different language (for example English). The approve and decline buttons should appear in any other language than Russian.

*Workaround 2*

This workaround requires a little bit of manual work and the manipulation of one of the Service Desk Jar file. This workaround was tested in Service Desk 4.3.0 and we verified that the Approval/Decline buttons appeared when switching to the Russian language:
!JSD430_Workaround.png|thumbnail!

The steps are listed below. (!) Please note that these tests are for the version 4.3.0, the same steps can be applied to different versions provided that "4.3.0" is replaced by the other version in the steps:
# Navigate to the link below to download the compatible OBR file for the current your JIRA version (4.3.0 in this case)
-- [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213632/jira-service-desk/version-history]
# After the OBR file is downloaded, change the {{.obr}} filetype to {{.zip}} so it can be unzipped
# Unzip the file. Inside it, there will be a JAR file called _"jira-servicedesk-application-4.3.0.jar"_
# Change the filetype from {{.jar}} to {{.zip}} as well to make it extractable
# Find the Russian translation file corresponding to the Approval functionality
-- In this case it is _jira-servicedesk-application-4.3.0 > i18n > sd-approvals-i18n_ru_RU.properties_.
 # Replace the line starting with {{sd.approval.status.pending.count}} with the following:
{code:java}
sd.approval.status.pending.count={0,choice,1\#\u041D\u0435\u043E\u0431\u0445\u043E\u0434\u0438\u043C\u043E \u0437\u0430\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0435\u043D\u0438\u0435|1<\u041D\u0435\u043E\u0431\u0445\u043E\u0434\u0438\u043C\u043E \u0437\u0430\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0435\u043D\u0438\u0435}\: {0}
{code}
(!) Please feel free to change the translation to a translation that fits better your needs, as long as this translation *follows the same structure* and is in *unicode encoding*
# Save the property file
# Using the terminal, navigate to the _jira-servicedesk-application-4.3.0_ directory where the jar file was unzipped
{code:java}
cd <path to dir>/jira-servicedesk-application-4.3.0{code}
# From inside the directory, run the following command:
{code:java}
jar cf ../jira-servicedesk-application-4.3.0.jar * {code}
# In Jira, go to the page *⚙ > Add-Ons > Manage Add-ons*
# Upload the modified Jar file there

*Important notes regarding the Workaround 2*
(!) For any existing users that already have Russian as their language set in the profile, the change *might not immediate*. Try creating a new user and change the user language to see the effect. Also, try accessing the ticket using another browser or in incognito mode for the testing.
(!) Such change will be *overwritten whenever Service Desk is upgraded*, therefore the same steps will need to be executed after each upgrade.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding Series and choosing SLA related-type, the  'JQL from SLA Goal' field will appear as an option:
 !SeriesAdd.png|thumbnail! 

However,  when editing the added Series, the  'JQL from SLA Goal' field will not appear:
 !SeriesModify.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a SD project, then *Report*
# Create a new Report
# Add a Series
# Choose  'JQL from SLA Goal' field and input a value
# Once Added, edit the newly added Series
# The  'JQL from SLA Goal' field would not be displayed

h3. Expected Results
The 'JQL from SLA Goal' field will be displayed when editing

h3. Actual Results
The  'JQL from SLA Goal' field would not be displayed when editing:
 !SeriesModify.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Below is the screen recording of further testings done:
 [^JSDSeriesBug.mp4] 
Here are some notable events during the tests:
# When creating the first Series, the 'JQL from SLA Goal' field will be displayed
# After the Series is created, when editing it, the 'JQL from SLA Goal' field will be missing
# Changing the Series to something different then back to the original one, will cause the 'JQL from SLA Goal' field to appear with the correct value
# Adding another Series (same or different type/value) into the report will cause the 'JQL from SLA Goal' field to appear when editing. However, the value will be incorrect.
# (When more than one Series is present) Editing the Series will show the incorrect value. Changing the Series to something different then back to the original one will cause the correct value to be shown
# Deleting the other Series and leaving only one will cause the 'JQL from SLA Goal' field to not be displayed again when editing

h3. Workaround
When Editing, change the Series to a different one then back to the original. This will cause the 'JQL from SLA Goal' field to be displayed with the correct value.

h3. Issue Summary
Alignment of the customer portal is not correct on the mobile device browser in the Jira Service Desk version prior to 4.1.0 that uses the *old portal*.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to access the customer portal on mobile device browser.
# The alignment of the portal is not correct on the mobile browser.

The customer portal should render and align correctly on a mobile device browser.

The customer portal is misaligned on the mobile device browser when using the old portal.

Able to replicate this behavior on Jira Software/Service Desk version 8.0.2/4.0.2 on chrome and default mobile browsers in my Android phone. This behavior is impacting the old portal only.  The new portal was released with version 4.1.0 which does not have this issue.

then:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Opening the Queue page will send out cache replication to other nodes for each queue's count. This cache is unique to each user.

In Data Center, when a user logged in to a node, the user will remain and stay on that node as long as the session remains active. It makes sense to have the cache to be a local cache rather than a global cache.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the Queue Count cache to be local to the node
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Create Queue Count Cache Local to Node

h3. Issue Summary
Page in question https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-customizing-the-customer-portal
Specifically states that Server
{quote}
While Jira Service Desk does not have a WYS/WYG editor built into the product 
{quote}
However, in regards to the customer portal, Service Desk Server can do this now.

We also have more current documentation in https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/a-stylish-new-portal-for-jira-service-desk-server-and-data-center-customers-963663645.html that explains Jira Service Desk Server can allow admins to change the way the customer portal looks, much in the same way JSD Cloud permits.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results
h3. Notes
It appears that many of these new changes were rolled out in JSD server 4.1.  And it looks like the old document was last updated well before that release.

h3. Workaround
none
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk customing the customer portal documentation on server is outdated

fields.description: As an administrator, I think it would be very useful if we were able to add Section Headers to collections of fields in the portal. This would allow for the separation of fields for a request type and would allow for them to be categorized based on type. I've attached a screenshot showing how an administrator accomplished this with a custom field type (called Bundled Field) from a third party add-on (Extensions for JSD) that allowed for the creation of a text field with no rows or values. It would be simpler if we just allowed for section headers out of the box.
fields.summary: Allow for Section Headers in Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
I have a running JSW installation with JSW licence. Installing JSD application from .obr and then adding the JSD licence. On the Admin/Issue Types I am not seeing JSD issue types, only JSW from initial installation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JSW 8.1.2 with JSW licence
 # Start and setup JSW 
 # on a running JSW 8.1.2 install JSD 4.1.2 from .obr
 # set the licence for JSW
 # go to Admin/Issues/Issue Types - JSD issue types are missing

h3. Expected Results

I can see JSD issue types


h3. Actual Results

JSD issue type are not defined.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Missing JSD issue types when installing from .obr

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have dozens of dashboards to manage on my JSD system, and when I call up a list of dashboards, the Manage Dashboards link at the end of the list is also off the screen and cannot be clicked.  Note this is applicable to Chrome as the browser, possible other browsers too, when the bookmarks bar is displayed. 

Reizing the page does not mitigate the problem and there is no way to scroll the list. The current work around is to turn off the bookmarks bar in the browser when using JSD.

I recommend either moving the Managed Dashboards link to the top of the list or shortening the list to allow room in the browser for the bookmarks bar. 

Apologies in advance, feel free to select a more appropriate component, such as UI, which did not see available.
fields.summary: Dashboard list extends past the browser display

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, Jira Service Desk Customer Portals are displaying the version of the Jira SD instance the portal is running on.

This may be a security issue, as an ill intended third party may use this information to pinpoint vulnerabilities and exploit them to get access/do some harm in the system.

Therefore, especially for institutions and sensitive customers, we suggest this version number to be hidden or at least to allow the Jira administrator to choose if it should be displayed or not.

Kind regards
fields.summary: [Customer Portal] Allow to remove Jira SD version from Portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Reporter and Request Participant cannot receive notification when comment is added with an attachment *from an incoming email*. Our documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/notifications-troubleshooting-203394737.html?_ga=2.50187044.36665971.1563294728-277273630.1525800863#NotificationsTroubleshooting-Commentscreatedfrome-maildonotgeneratenotifications] says:

{quote}When JIRA applications process mail to add comments, if an attachment is included in the email it will fire an Issue Updated event instead of an Issue Commented event.{quote}

However, as per [JSDSERVER-4506|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4506],

{quote}there're certain events where Customers (Reporters, Request Participants) do not receive notifications e.g. Issue Assigned, Issue Moved, Issue Updated.{quote}

This caused the issue where Reporter and Request Participant cannot receive a notification when a comment is added with a screenshot, as it fires an Issue Updated event but that doesn't work for Customer Notifications apparently.

h3. Environment
Jira 7.13.x
Jira 8.2.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Have a comment added to a ticket with a screenshot attached on it, using an incoming mail (not from the UI)
# Have the *Public Comment Added* rule configured for Customer Notifications

h3. Expected Results
Reporter and Request Participant should receive the notification

h3. Actual Results
Reporter and Request Participant won't receive any notification.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Commenting by email with an attachment does not send notification for Reporter and Request Participant

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an issue is created thought e-mail and there is more than one attachment with the same name, JSD creates a new ticket replacing all the attachments by the last one with the same name on the description of the issue.
h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk 4.2.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an e-mail to create the ticket with two or more attachments with the same name.

h3. Expected Results
The expected result would be that Jira Service Desk displays the attachments correctly on the Description.
h3. Actual Results
Jira Service Desk replace all the attachments with the same name by the last one identified in the e-mail.
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Attachments with the same name through e-mail are not being identify by Jira Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Use Case

JSD is used in one company as an internal helpdesk center, only. All "customers" are already known and can already log in. From former times, they are also used to send emails for raising issues. By enabling "Email Requests" also the public sign up feature is enabled.
h3. Problem

Some of the customers landing on the portal login page are confused by the link "Sign up for an account" and create a 2nd account. Agents have extra efforts.
h3. Work-a-Round

1) Blocking the sign up page by adding a "Context" element in server.xml or any equivalent on the reverse proxy side. This just works when the customer presses "Submit". Page is not blocked upfront. Following error is then shown: "We are unable to submit your request. Please refresh the page and try again. ...".

2) install SSO, so the customer will (almost) never see the login page.
h3. Solution

Add somewhere (at the customize sidebar?) a checkbox, that simply hides / disables this sign up link with its descriptive text.
fields.summary: Configuration to hide/disable "Sign up for an account" link

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When a customer portal is being loaded up, JSD always try to load the banner image for a customised portal. This happens to all portals regardless they are customised or not.

If there is no customisation, the following message is logged
{code:none}
/servicedesk/customer/portal/3 [c.a.j.p.assets.impl.AssetStorageManagerImpl] Can't find asset: com.atlassian.servicedesk/banner.json: Path does not exist{code}
Although this can be safely ignored, it indicates that JSD doesn't even check for any customisations before loading anything.
h4. Suggestion
 * Include a check before loading any customizations
 * Change the message to something less dramatic

h4. Workaround

Configure logging package {{com.atlassian.jira.plugins.assets.impl}} with WARN level to make sure the message doesn't get logged.

For permanent logging change, update the log4j.properties file:
 * [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0713/logging-and-profiling-964983962.html]
 * Add:
{code:java}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira.plugins.assets.impl = WARN, filelog
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.plugin.classloader = false
{code}
 * Restart
fields.summary: Message 'Can't find asset: com.atlassian.servicedesk/banner.json' should be suppressed when there are no customisations in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Service Desk executes *3* of the same query on {{/comment}} action to retrieve Automation details. This can be said the same for every Jira Issue events that are listened by Service Desk Automation.

The query can be seen listed as one of the top CPU used for the database. Example:
|| SQL_TEXT	|| CPU_TIME ||	ELAPSED_TIME ||	DISK_READS ||	BUFFER_GETS	|| ROWS_PROCESSED ||
| select "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA"."CONFIG_DATA_KEY" ..... |	1497.73 |	2299.6 |	391859 |	45396207 |	113867450 |
| select "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA"."CONFIG_DATA_KEY" ..... | 619.44 |	777.44 |	452 |	23002786 |	23990452 |

|| ELAPSED_TIME || 	EXECUTIONS ||	BUFFER_GETS ||	DISK_READS ||	SQL_TEXT ||
| 2300.790011 |	43487 |	45422987 |	392093	| select "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA"."CONFIG_DATA_KEY" ..... |
| 777.843497 |	43487 |	23016436 |	452	| select "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA"."CONFIG_DATA_KEY"..... |

Example SQL queries:
{code}
select "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA"."CONFIG_DATA_KEY", "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA"."CONFIG_DATA_VALUE", "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA"."ID", "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA"."THEN_ACTION_CONFIG_ID" from "public"."AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA" "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA" join "public"."AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACTION_CONFIG" "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACTION_CONFIG" on "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACTION_CONFIG"."ID" = "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA"."THEN_ACTION_CONFIG_ID" join "public"."AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN" "AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN" on "AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN"."ID" = "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACTION_CONFIG"."IF_THEN_ID" join "public"."AO_9B2E3B_RULE" "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" on "AO_9B2E3B_RULE"."ID" = "AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN"."RULE_ID" where "AO_9B2E3B_RULE"."RULESET_REVISION_ID" in (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
{code}
{code}
select "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA"."CONFIG_DATA_KEY", "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA"."CONFIG_DATA_VALUE", "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA"."ID", "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA"."IF_CONDITION_CONFIG_ID" from "public"."AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA" "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA" join "public"."AO_9B2E3B_IF_CONDITION_CONFIG" "AO_9B2E3B_IF_CONDITION_CONFIG" on "AO_9B2E3B_IF_CONDITION_CONFIG"."ID" = "AO_9B2E3B_IF_COND_CONF_DATA"."IF_CONDITION_CONFIG_ID" join "public"."AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN" "AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN" on "AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN"."ID" = "AO_9B2E3B_IF_CONDITION_CONFIG"."IF_THEN_ID" join "public"."AO_9B2E3B_RULE" "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" on "AO_9B2E3B_RULE"."ID" = "AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN"."RULE_ID" where "AO_9B2E3B_RULE"."RULESET_REVISION_ID" in (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Considering that Automation configuration of a Service desk project is not modified often, caching these can be seen beneficial.
 
h3. Workaround 
_None_
fields.summary: Cache Service Desk Automation data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk executes multiple queries to retrieve the Organization data on {{getOrganisationById}} and {{getMembersOfOrganization}} when any user view an issue. 

A single query to the database is very efficient, however, totaling all suggest a high database CPU usage. Example:
* getOrganisationById
|| SQL_TEXT	 || CPU_TIME ||	ELAPSED_TIME ||	DISK_READS ||	BUFFER_GETS ||	ROWS_PROCESSED ||
| select "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION"."ID", "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION"."NAME" from "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION" "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION" where "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION"."ID" = :1  |	*14299.257* |	*51110.270655* |	147 |	2859463246 |	1430165288 |
* getMembersOfOrganization
|| RANK ||	ELAPSED_TIME	|| EXECUTIONS ||	BUFFER_GETS	|| DISK_READS	|| SQL_TEXT	|| 
| 2 |	*1668.249117* |	*27996574* |	139758967 |	3 	|	select * from (   select "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER"."ID" from "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER" "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER" ..... |
{code}
select * from (   select "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER"."ID" from "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER" "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER" inner join "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION" "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION" on "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION"."ID" = "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER"."ORGANIZATION_ID" inner join "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT" "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT" on "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT"."ORGANIZATION_ID" = "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION"."ID" where "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_PROJECT"."PROJECT_ID" = :1  and "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER"."USER_KEY" = :2  and "AO_54307E_ORGANIZATION_MEMBER"."ORGANIZATION_ID" = :3  ) where rownum <= :4
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
* Reduce the total number of query execution on issue view
* Cache the Organization data 


h3. Workaround 
_None_
fields.summary: Reduce querying Organization data from Database

fields.description:
*Summary:*

In Service Desk, there is a condition called "Block transition until approval" which is used by workflow with approval status.
This condition only works for the 2 transitions which are connected to the status with approval, but it has absolutely no effect if it is added to any other transition in the workflow.

*Steps to reproduce:*

- Create a fresh Service Desk project
- Take a look at the default workflow with approval "Service Request Fulfilment with Approvals workflow for Jira Service Desk", and notice that:
-- the status "WAITING FOR APPROVAL" is configured by default with an Approval:
 !WorkflowScreenshot1.png|thumbnail! 
 !WorkflowScreenshot2.png|thumbnail! 
-- the "Transition when approved" setting is mapped to the transition "Approved", and the "Transition when declined" setting is mapped to the transition "Declined"
-- the "Declined" and "Approved" transitions are automatically configured with the condition "Block transition until approval" (="Issue transition will be blocked if there is a pending approval):
 !WorkflowScreenshot3.png|thumbnail! 
 !WorkflowScreenshot4.png|thumbnail! 
- Edit this workflow by adding the condition "Block transition until approval" to the transition "Cancel Request" which is connected from the status "WAITING FOR APPROVAL" to the status "CANCELED"
 !WorkflowScreenshot5.png|thumbnail! 
 !WorkflowScreenshot6.png|thumbnail! 
- Publish the workflow
- Create a new request using this workflow, with user1 as the reporter and user2 as the approver
- Open the request by being logged in as user1
- Check that:
-- the request is in the status "WAITING FOR APPROVAL"
-- the 2 transitions used in the approval configuration "Approved" and "Declined" are blocked as expected, since they can only be executed by the approver "user2"
-- however, the "Cancel Request" transition is still available and working, despite the condition "Block transition until approval"
 !RequestToBeApproved_CancelStatusShowing.png|thumbnail! 


*Suggested solution:*

It has been confirmed that this current behavior is intended by design (according to how the code was implemented), and is due to some workflow limitation.
However, this behavior is not ideal and is confusing, since the workflow allows us to add the condition "Block transition until approval" to any transition, even though it has no effect.

2 possible solution to this problem:
- either make this condition effective when it's added to any transition in the workflow
- or don't allow this condition to be added to any transition, since it has no effect anyway
fields.summary: Make the "Block transition until approval" condition work for any transition in the workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary

The knowledge base (KB) search does not return any result when performed on the Main Help Center and if a Service Desk project is configured with a private space in Confluence.
h3. Environment

Tested with JIRA 8.1.0 (Service Desk 4.1.0) and Confluence 6.15.4, but also reported by a customer using JIRA 7.12.3 (Service Desk 3.15.3) with Confluence 6.12.1
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Setup a JIRA and Confluence instance with an application link configured with "Oauth with impersonation"
 # In Confluence, create 2 spaces:
 ## a non personal space (let's call it "KFS")
 ## a person space (let's call is "julien")
 # In each space, create a page containing the key word "laptop"
 # In JIRA, create 2 Service Desk projects, and configure a knowledge base in each project:
 ## a project with the non personal space
 ## a project with the personal space
 # Open the main customer portal page (with URL <JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portals)
 # Look for the key word "laptop"

h3. Actual result
 - The search returns no result coming from the Confluence spaces
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-10 at 10.50.11 AM.png|thumbnail!
 - Looking into the HAR file, we can see that the following JIRA end point is accessed:
{code:java}
<JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sharedportal/kb/articles?query=laptop&_=1562748676552
{code}

 - Looking into the appache http logs, we can see that the following request is sent to Confluence (notice the ~ character which is not in double-quote):
{code:java}
<CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL>/rest/knowledge-base/1.0/search?type=page&queryString=(laptop)+AND+(spacekey:~julien+OR+spacekey:KFS)&xoauth_requestor_id=julien
{code}

 - the following result is returned from Confluence:
{code:java}
{"results":[],"total":0,"archivedResultsCount":0,"uuid":"XXXXXXXXXX","timeSpent":10}
{code}

h3. Expected result
 - The search should return the page that contains the word laptop from each space (the personal and the non-personal).
 - The "~" character in the request sent to confluence should be in double-quote as shown below:
{code:java}
<CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL>/rest/knowledge-base/1.0/search?type=page&queryString=(laptop)+AND+(spacekey:"~julien"+OR+spacekey:KFS)&xoauth_requestor_id=julien
{code}

 - In this case, the following result should be returned from Confluence:
{code:java}
{"results":[{"id":327766,"title":"Request a @@@hl@@@laptop@@@endhl@@@","bodyTextHighlights":"@@@hl@@@laptop@@@endhl@@@","url":"/display/KFS/Request+a+laptop?src=search","searchResultContainer":{"name":"KB for SD","url":"/confluence6154/display/KFS"},"friendlyDate":"yesterday at 4:05 PM","contentType":"page","metadata":{"likes":"0"}},{"id":327772,"title":"@@@hl@@@laptop@@@endhl@@@","bodyTextHighlights":"blablabla","url":"/display/~julien/laptop?src=search","searchResultContainer":{"name":"Julien Rey","url":"/confluence6154/display/~julien"},"friendlyDate":"2 minutes ago","contentType":"page","metadata":{"likes":"0"}}],"total":2,"archivedResultsCount":0,"uuid":"XXXXXXXXXXX","timeSpent":8}
{code}

h3. Workaround

A workaround consist in not configuring any Service Desk project with a Confluence personal space, since only personal spaces contain the character "~".
fields.summary: The knowledge base search does not return any result on the main help center when a personal space is configured in Service Desk

fields.description:
When submitting an issue from the customer portal for a request that creates an issue with Issue Security applied, if the user that submits the issue will not have visibility to the issue, there is no indication that the issue was submitted and created successfully. This causes confusion and causes the creator to attempt submitting the issue again.

It would be great to have a visible notification that the issue was created after the request is submitted. Even better, it would be great if it included the issue key as well.

We have our Service Desk set up so that the Help Desk personnel can submit certain requests which will have sensitive information and therefore have issue security set to the reporter and only those special teams. When the Help Desk agent submits the request, they are unsure that the issue was created successfully since they do not have access to the issue. In addition, they don't have access to the issue key to provide to the customer when taking a request over the phone.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When there are multiple approvers on an issue, if only one denies or approves, the issue is transitioned without giving other approvers an opportunity to agree or disagree. This results in a lot of administrative work as these issues have to be placed back into a status requiring approval so the approval step can be repeated. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Create a way to configure workflow transitions for approvals based on the number of approvals/rejections. For example, if I have three approvers on an issue, I could set the following for the approval:
* *Required to approve:* 1
* *Required to deny:* 2

In this example, if any one approver gives the green light, the request is approved. If one denies it, however, another will have to agree to deny the request.

h3. Why this is important

This allows my team to more effectively distribute approval responsibility without creating significant administrative overhead.
 
h3. Workaround 

No workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Allow multiple approvals/denials for a request to transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Jira Service Desk approval notifications are not being sent if certain conditions are met. More in the "Steps to Reproduce" section.

h3. Environment
Jira Service Desk 3.9.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
{panel}
# If the approver selection is done during the issue creation step from the portal.
#* Set up approval to be first status of workflow.
#* Set up approval selection via the approval field (or other custom field) during issue creation.
#* Create the issue, and define the approver during creation.
#* *No approver notifications are received.*
# Or, second scenario, where the approver is selected after the issue is created AND before issue creation confirmation email is set.
#* Set up approval to be first status of workflow.
#* Create the issue, but do not pick the approver yet.
#* Define the approver after the issue has been created.
#* Two things can happen from here:
#** If the "Issue created email" has been sent BEFORE approver is selected, the *approver notifications works fine* (sent to the approvers).
#** If the "Issue created email" has not been queue in mail queue and the approver is selected, then *approver notifications cannot be sent* (no approver mails queued).
{panel}

h3. Expected Results
Approver notifications are received.

h3. Actual Results
No approver notifications are received if certain conditions above are met.

h3. Notes
NA

h3. Workaround
Upgrading could help. The problem does not happen in Jira Service Desk 4.2.0.
fields.summary: Approval notifications on first workflow steps are not being sent

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Similar to the 'Create Issue' page in Jira internally, we would like the *Create another* checkbox when creating issue via customer portal. Also, we would like for the ability to have a turn on/off button for the ability to choose the option to revert back to the 'Create Issue' page everytime once an issue is created. 

This would be easier if the customers come in a continuous stream. In a scenario where there is an IT helpdesk with people in line, we would want people to click create - and then this view to be ready for the next person in line. 

Ideally, when they click Create it would quickly confirm that the issue is created and then redirects user back to the 'Create Issue' page so that the next user can create an issue without having to manually having to go back to the next page.
fields.summary: Provide the 'Create another' button in the Customer Portal or the ability to choose the option to revert back to the 'Create Issue' page everytime once an issue is created.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Text is squeezed on field values instead of being wrapped correctly on a 1280x1080 resolution. This makes reading values hard and not practical.

h3. Environment

* SD 4.2.2
* IE/Google Chrome
* 1280x1080 screen resolution (We mention minimum resolution on the [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/supported-platforms-938846830.html] is 1024 x 768)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access an SD project from the Queues page
 # Expand the Project pane
 # Have the *Queues* pane expanded too

h3. Expected Results

Text is wrapped correctly and readable.

h3. Actual Results

Text shows all squeezed making it hard to visualise.

 !image (3).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Try to contract the project pane so the values have more space to render.
fields.summary: Text is squeezed on field values instead of being wrapped correctly on a 1280x1080 resolution.

*Explanation*

Subject field that carries more than 255 characters will cause the SQL injection to return error therefore hitting into a halt.

*Workaround*

# We can manually increase the column size as shown below:
{code:sql}ALTER TABLE "AO_2C4E5C_MAILITEM" ALTER "SUBJECT" TYPE varchar(500);{code}
(!) Keep in mind that this column size will be modified to its original value as soon you restart Jira or execute an upgrade so don't forget to apply the workaround again
# You can remove the message that is exceeding the size from the Inbox

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Definition

When a licensed JIRA user tried to create an article from the Knowledge Base section of a SD project, it doesn't allow him to create the Space linked to a Service Desk project which allows anonymous access but restricted to page creation. Instead, it pre-selects another Space that has anonymous access and page creation allowed. 

h3. Suggestion
If the page creation is restricted to publicly available space, it makes sense to have a login prompt rather than preselecting another Space which allows page creation for anonymous user. Otherwise, the user is not aware of what he needs to do.
fields.summary: Login Prompt when creating a Knowledge Base article

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi

To keep a long story short. What we lack is a proper way to handle incidents and the communication part with customers.

1.  an incident (Jira issue) need a connection to multiple (affected customers). we solved this by adding customers as objects in Insight and then add customers to the incident ticket which is not ideal when we have the customers already in SD. To add on that, the customer in SD is not necessarily the right contact for incidents so that needs to be handled in another way.

2. it should be possible to have different customer incident data for the same incident without having to create subtasks or similar. For instance, downtime can differ from customer to customer. With over 200 customer I dont want to have 200 subtasks. but I still want to be able to add downtime/uptime info for each customer.

3. a neat way to communicate with the customers (incident contacts). I want to be able to send updates about the incident, containing incident information and also unique data like the downtime/uptime to assigned incident contacts with a preview functionality so that IMs can view and verify the mail going out before it reaches the customer. 

 

Today im trying to solve this with Insight plugin to keep all customer organizations and their insight contacts as objects and hten use a script so find all selected affected customers, find the contacts email and generate an email. This is quite heavy stuff. And still I dont know how to solve the problem with keeping only the incident ticket but different customer data without subtasks. i think ServiceNow can do this.

 

thanks you
fields.summary: customer oriented incident management solution needed

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After the request is submitted using the raise request button, the view shows the customer view of the request within the pop-up window.

In earlier versions like 4.0.1 clicking on the IT number here will result in the Agent view of the issue opening in a new tab/window. 

On the newer version of Service Desk (4.1.1) this results in the site loading in the pop-up window.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the "*Raise Request*" button and create a new request
# Click on the issue ID from the pop-up window

h3. Expected Results
JSD would open the agent view on a new tab/window

h3. Actual Results
JSD open the agent view on the same pop-up window

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using the "Raise Request" button and clicking the issue id from within the popup window will load the agent view of the issue inside the popup window instead of opening a new tab

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After converting projects to Service Desk project, it seems that all JIRA users will be added as Customers, even when the Customer Permission is set to "Customers who are added to the project".  There is no way to remove the users as Customers. The users do not even appear as "Service Desk Customers" Project Role.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Software/Core project
# Convert it to Service Desk project
# Check that the Customer Permission is set to "Customers who are added to the project"
# Go to *Customers* page and you should be able to see all the users as Customers despite not adding them in
** It is not possible to remove them as Customers

h3. Expected Results
The *Customers* page would be empty when the Customer Permission is set to "Customers who are added to the project" and able to manually add/remove users as Customers

h3. Actual Results
Users will automatically be added as Customers and are not able to be removed

h3. Workaround
Create a new Service Desk project rather than converting projects
fields.summary: Projects converted to Service Desk project will add all users as Customers
